user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 is: A pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_:
```c
static int
mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_ (void)
{
  int ret = -1;
#if defined(HAVE_SYSCONF) && \
  (defined(HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU) || defined(HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF))
  long value = -1;
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_CRAY_NCPU);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU */
#ifdef HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF
  if (0 >= value)
    value = sysconf (_SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF);
#endif /* HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF */
  if (0 >= value)
    return -1;
  ret = (int) value;
  if ((long) ret != value)
    return -1; /* Overflow */
#endif /* HAVE_SYSCONF &&
          (HAS_DECL__SC_CRAY_NCPU || HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF) */
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are related to the target function mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_sysconf_fallback_:
#define HAVE_SYSCONF 1
...
#define HAS_DECL__SC_NPROCESSORS_CONF 1
</additional code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No pointer usage exists in the provided function. The code declares only scalar variables (int ret; long value), uses the sysconf call which returns a long by value, performs integer casts and comparisons, and contains preprocessor conditionals. There are no pointer declarations, no pointer parameters or return types, no address-of (&) or indirection (*) operations, and no pointer casts that could implicate const qualification. Therefore MISRA C 2023 Rule 8.13 (pointer should point to a const-qualified type whenever possible) is not applicable to any fragment of this function; no fragments need investigation for this rule.
